III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS & CONCLUSIONS
A. Physical Description of Facility
The facility is new construction in a residential area in Adrian and is handicap
accessible. The 10-bed, single story, non-secure building is located at the end of a
dead-end street. There is a wooded area behind and to the side and a field in front,
across the street, which provides plenty of play area outside. When entering the front
door from the parking lot, there is a foyer which opens to a large open room. This room
is the central point of the facility and has windows and a door wall on the far side facing
2

the wooded area. There is a large multiuse table (dining/homework/crafts/gathering)
and chairs, and plenty of open space. To the right of this main room, is one living area
with a couch, chair, and built-in television cabinet. Past the living area is a hallway. All
bedrooms are down this hall. There are 4 double occupancy bedrooms and two single
occupancy bedrooms to accommodate various needs. Bedrooms are fully furnished
with beds, bedding and dressers. There is a room that is planned to be a sensory room,
a laundry room, and two full bathrooms on this hall as well. There is an exit door at the
end of this hall.
To the left of the main room is a second living area with a couch, chair and built-in
television cabinet. Next to the television cabinet is a built-in, locked window that
connects to the medication room. This window will be used for medication passing. The
kitchen is partially open to the main room as well. The kitchen is fully equipped with
appliances, dishes, cups, silverware, cookware, etc. There is a large walk-in pantry off
the rear of the kitchen for stocking supplies. The facility is equipped with all new
appliances, cabinets, countertops, and furnishings. Past the second living area is
another shorter hall. Off this hall are locked rooms that house mechanicals, camera
servers, and electrical, and heating equipment. At the end of this hall is the large,
attached garage.
Off the central main room, opposite the windows, is the office area which is secured by
a locked door. In this space there is a large meeting room with a conference table and
chairs. This room will be used for meetings and visitation. There are offices for staff and
a staff restroom, as well as the nursing room that will house medications and medical
supplies. There is secured space for client information in this area as well. The entire
facility has camera surveillance and is sprinklered for fire emergency.
B. Program Description
The program is a residential mental health and behavior stabilization facility providing
services for children and youth ages 6-17 years. Clients will be supervised by staff at a
ratio of 1 staff per 2 clients. The program provides immediate housing and basic needs,
along with multidisciplinary treatment services, behavioral health treatment, case
management, educational coordination, recreational opportunities, transportation
assistance, and aftercare services. The agency refers to and utilizes community
partners for all routine and non-routine medical, dental, optical, psychiatric, or specialty
service needs.
C. Rule/Statutory Violations
The facility was found to be compliant with applicable rules and statues that were
reviewed prior to licensure. The facility has provided documentation and information to
indicate that they intend to comply with licensing rules and statues for which compliance
can only be determined after the institution has become fully operational.
